Module swirlds.platform
Package com.swirlds.crypto

Interface DigitalSignature

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Algorithm, AutoCloseable
    public interface DigitalSignature
extends Algorithm, AutoCloseable
    Encapsulates a cryptographic digital signature.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        static DigitalSignature getInstance​(String algorithm)
                             throws NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                    NoSuchProviderException
        Retrieves an instance of the desired digital signature algorithm, if available. By default will prefer a GPU enabled implementation over a CPU enabled implementation. Will fall back on a CPU implementation in the absence of an available GPU implementation or supported GPU acceleration card.
        Parameters:
        algorithm - the identifier for the requested algorithm
        Returns:
        a DigitalSignature implementation for the requested algorithm
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - if there are no available or supported implementations for the requested algorithm
        NoSuchProviderException - if there are no registered providers that can support the requested algorithm

      • verify

        void verify​(Signature signature)
        Verifies the given digital signature for authenticity. The result of the verification will be returned by the Signature.getSignatureStatus() method once the future (available via Signature.getFuture()) has been completed.
        Parameters:
        signature - the signature to be verified

      • verify

        void verify​(Signature... signatures)
        Verifies the given digital signatures for authenticity. The result of the verification will be returned by the Signature.getSignatureStatus() method once the future (available via Signature.getFuture()) has been completed.
        Parameters:
        signatures - an array of signatures to be verified

      • verify

        void verify​(List<Signature> signatures)
        Verifies the given digital signatures for authenticity. The result of the verification will be returned by the Signature.getSignatureStatus() method once the future (available via Signature.getFuture()) has been completed.
        Parameters:
        signatures - a list of signatures to be verified

      • verifyAsync

        static void verifyAsync​(Signature... signatures)
        Verifies the given digital signatures for authenticity. The result of the verification will be returned by the Signature.getSignatureStatus() method once the future (available via Signature.getFuture()) has been completed. Note: This implementation is non-blocking and returns almost immediately.
        Parameters:
        signatures - an array of signatures to be verified

      • verifyAsync

        static void verifyAsync​(List<Signature> signatures)
        Verifies the given digital signatures for authenticity. The result of the verification will be returned by the Signature.getSignatureStatus() method once the future (available via Signature.getFuture()) has been completed. Note: This implementation is non-blocking and returns almost immediately.
        Parameters:
        signatures - a list of signatures to be verified

      • verifySync

        boolean verifySync​(Signature signature)
        Verifies the given digital signature for authenticity. The result of the verification will be returned by the Signature.getSignatureStatus() method once the future (available via Signature.getFuture()) has been completed.
        Parameters:
        signature - the signature to be verified
        Returns:
        true if the signature is valid; otherwise false

      • verifySync

        boolean verifySync​(List<Signature> signatures)
        Verifies the given digital signatures for authenticity. The result of the verification will be returned by the Signature.getSignatureStatus() method once the future (available via Signature.getFuture()) has been completed.
        Parameters:
        signatures - a list of signatures to be verified
        Returns:
        true if all the signatures are valid; otherwise false
